definitions.definition: a word that refers to a person (such as Ann or doctor), a place (such as Paris or city) or a thing, a quality or an activity (such as plant, joy or tennis)

examples.text: Proper nouns begin with a capital letter.
‘Sheep’ is both a singular and a plural noun.
English nouns are not usually inflected.
Most English plural nouns end in an ‘s’.
Most feminine nouns in Polish end in the letter ‘a’.
The noun is followed by an intransitive verb.
a prepositional phrase qualifying a noun

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French, from Latin nomen ‘name’.
